title: Spring Boot 3 support
body:
This PR addresses issue #1144 

- Support Spring Boot 3 and Jakarta EE 9
- Switch the release version of Java to 11 for better support of JDK 17
- Switch the release version of telegrambots-spring-boot-starter to Java 17

title: Add the ability to add a spoiler to the bot message.
body: Add the ability to add a spoiler to the bot message.

title: Spring boot 3.0 and jakarta.xml
body:
Hi.

I upgrade to spring boot 3.0 and runtime failed to find  `javax.xml.*` classes, it needed by `JaxbAnnotationModule`, that provided in `com.fasterxml.jackson.module:jackson-module-jaxb-annotations`. It is dependency of  `org.telegram:telegrambots-meta:6.3.0` and `com.fasterxml.jackson.jaxrs:jackson-jaxrs-json-provider`.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1404372/203927824-2894cc98-bc55-40a2-9417-b835e56b57e4.png)

Downgrading of `jakarta.xml.bind:jakarta.xml.bind-api` back to 2.3.3 breaks another jackson module

title: How to get new chat member in super group?
body: I use spring-boot-starter:6.1 with bot long polling mode. I use #Message.getNewChatMembers() method to get new members of the group. This method works for groups with less than 10,000 members, but not for super groups with more than 10,000 members. In a super group of over 10,000 people, I can't get any updates when a new member joins. Can anyone tell me how to get it

title: Support for Spring Boot 3
body: Spring Boot 3 will release in November 2022. It has [multiple breaking changes](https://spring.io/blog/2022/05/24/preparing-for-spring-boot-3-0) including a Java 17 and Jakarta EE 9 requirement. I have been experimenting with this over on [a fork](https://github.com/recursiveribbons/TelegramBots/tree/java-11-spring-boot-3), with moving everything to Java 11 and the Spring Boot Starter to Java 17, and Jakarta EE 9.

title: After running the bot for some time, it will throw httpclient timeout waiting for connection from pool
body: **Describe the bug** Sometimes I got this error, and I just have this problem once/twice in a week, it seems random, after I reboot my program, it works again. I searched around and some people say I don't close the http client correctly, but I just use the default long pooling bot settings. ``` class TelegramLongPollingBot2 extends TelegramLongPollingBot {} ``` I also found this issue, maybe this helps me, but my version is the 6.0.1, the newest version. https://github.com/rubenlagus/TelegramBots/issues/564 **Screenshots**

title: Shutting down the bot if an error [409] Conflict was received
body:
**Language: Kotlin**

I register a bot ()
```
val botSession = botsApi.registerBot(bot)
```

And at some point, the owner of the bot token, for example, my client, can run the bot on their side.

I need:

1. Or catch the appropriate exception:
```
org.telegram.telegrambots.meta.exceptions.TelegramApiRequestException: Error getting updates: [409] Conflict: terminated by other getUpdates request; make sure that only one bot instance is running
	at org.telegram.telegrambots.meta.api.methods.updates.GetUpdates.deserializeResponse(GetUpdates.java:93)
	at org.telegram.telegrambots.updatesreceivers.DefaultBotSession$ReaderThread.getUpdatesFromServer(DefaultBotSession.java:260)
	at org.telegram.telegrambots.updatesreceivers.DefaultBotSession$ReaderThread.run(DefaultBotSession.java:189)
```
For me to stop the bot on my side.

2. Or automatically stop the pull bot here:
Package: org.telegram.telegrambots.updatesreceivers
Class: DefaultBotSession
Private class: ReaderThread
Method: getUpdatesFromServer()
```
...
} catch (SocketException | InvalidObjectException | TelegramApiRequestException e) {
    log.error(e.getLocalizedMessage(), e);
} 
...
```

In any case, it would be great to provide users with the ability to handle errors. Since I found a lot of chat requests - https://t.me/JavaBotsApi. People often ask about this issue.

P. S.: I will add that there is 1 more case: the user can create a bot in BotFather, register its token using the library. The user can then change the bot's token in BotFather. After that, errors will appear in the application - [401] Unauthorized:
`ERROR o.t.t.u.DefaultBotSession.getUpdatesFromServer - Error getting updates: [401] Unauthorized
`

```
final SendMediaGroup sendMediaGroup = SendMediaGroup.builder()
                .chatId(chatId)
                .medias(mediaPhotos)
                .build();

        sender.execute(sendMediaGroup);
```

title: SendAudio, using HTTP URLs as "audio" field
body: Hello. While reading api documentation about sending audiofiles I found that the "audio" field can be both of type InputFile and String. If it is String, then it should be a url for downloading the audio. In the current realization of SendAudio there is no option to send non-InputFile argument for the audio field. Adding this feature would ease the sending audio process a lot. Thanks.

title: Optimize imports for CreateInvoiceLink and SendInvoice classes
body: Fixed a bug in the deserializeResponse method of the CreateInvoiceLink class [issues #1115 ](https://github.com/rubenlagus/TelegramBots/issues/1115) And optimized imports for the CreateInvoiceLink and SendInvoice classes

title: CreateInvoiceLink return string, not message
body:
when I'm trying to execute CreateInvoiceLink and get result to variable my code failed with exception
`Caused by: com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.MismatchedInputException: Cannot construct instance of org.telegram.telegrambots.meta.api.objects.Message (although at least one Creator exists): no String-argument constructor/factory method to deserialize from String value ('https://t.me/invoice_url')
 at [Source: (String)"{"ok":true,"result":"https://t.me/INVOICE_URL"}"; line: 1, column: 21] (through reference chain: org.telegram.telegrambots.meta.api.objects.ApiResponse["result"])`

it is cause CreateInvoiceLink return string result
https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#createinvoicelink
(Use this method to create a link for an invoice. Returns the created invoice link as String on success.)

title: [400] Bad Request: wrong file identifier/HTTP URL specified
body:
Hi, 

Could you please help me to understand why I can't send this video to telegram?

Link to video: https://v.redd.it/0w3soe17hve91/DASH_1080.mp4

**My code**
```java
SendVideo sendVideo = SendVideo.builder()
        .chatId(String.valueOf(CHANNEL_ID))
        .video(new InputFile("https://v.redd.it/0w3soe17hve91/DASH_1080.mp4"))
        .caption("Some text")
        .build();

execute(sendVideo);
```

**Stack trace**
```
Error executing org.telegram.telegrambots.meta.api.methods.send.SendVideo query: [400] Bad Request: wrong file identifier/HTTP URL specified
	at org.telegram.telegrambots.meta.api.methods.PartialBotApiMethod.deserializeResponseInternal(PartialBotApiMethod.java:53)
	at org.telegram.telegrambots.meta.api.methods.PartialBotApiMethod.deserializeResponse(PartialBotApiMethod.java:33)
	at org.telegram.telegrambots.meta.api.methods.send.SendVideo.deserializeResponse(SendVideo.java:99)
	at org.telegram.telegrambots.bots.DefaultAbsSender.execute(DefaultAbsSender.java:314)
	at app.funclub.anadearmas.telegram.AnadeArmasFanbot.sendVideo(AnadeArmasFanbot.java:56)
	at app.funclub.anadearmas.Main.main(Main.java:89)
```

**Dependency**
```xml
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.telegram</groupId>
    <artifactId>telegrambots</artifactId>
    <version>6.1.0</version>
</dependency>
```

title: Unable to send an animated sticker
body:
**Describe the bug**
I am able to retrieve the `file_path` of a sticker that has been sent into the bot. I can retrieve the InputFile of still-image stickers (`.webp` format) and send it over to the user. However, the same code breaks and cannot send an animated sticker. The retrieved file size is the correct size of the original sticker which suggests that I can correctly retrieve the animated sticker. But the `SendSticker` object is unable to send stickers with the `.tgs` format.

**Expected behavior**
`SendSticker` object should be able to send animated and non-animated stickers with `.tgs` and `.webp` format respectively.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/71893643/180612094-676fcefa-3c71-4f75-9b25-e04522c3220d.png)

**Additional context**
I am using the latest version `v6.1.0`
